00091 typedef unsigned long xnarch_cpumask_t;
00092 #define xnarch_num_online_cpus()         XNARCH_NR_CPUS
00093 #define xnarch_cpu_online_map            ((1<<xnarch_num_online_cpus()) - 1)
00094 #define xnarch_cpu_set(cpu, mask)        ((mask) |= 1 << (cpu))
00095 #define xnarch_cpu_clear(cpu, mask)      ((mask) &= 1 << (cpu))
00096 #define xnarch_cpus_clear(mask)          ((mask) = 0UL)
00097 #define xnarch_cpu_isset(cpu, mask)      (!!((mask) & (1 << (cpu))))
00098 #define xnarch_cpus_and(dst, src1, src2) ((dst) = (src1) & (src2))
00099 #define xnarch_cpus_equal(mask1, mask2)  ((mask1) == (mask2))
00100 #define xnarch_cpus_empty(mask)          ((mask) == 0UL)
00101 #define xnarch_cpumask_of_cpu(cpu)       (1 << (cpu)) 
00102 #define xnarch_first_cpu(mask)           (ffnz(mask))
00103 #define XNARCH_CPU_MASK_ALL              (~0UL)
00104 
00105 #define xnarch_ullmod(ull,uld,rem)   ((*rem) = ((ull) % (uld)))
00106 #define xnarch_uldivrem(ull,uld,rem) ((u_long)xnarch_ulldiv((ull),(uld),(rem)))
00107 #define xnarch_uldiv(ull, d)         xnarch_uldivrem(ull, d, NULL)
00108 #define xnarch_ulmod(ull, d)         ({ u_long _rem;                    \
00109                                         xnarch_uldivrem(ull,d,&_rem); _rem; })

00111 static inline int xnarch_imuldiv(int i, int mult, int div)
00112 {
00113     unsigned long long ull = (unsigned long long) (unsigned) i * (unsigned) mult;
00114     return ull / (unsigned) div;
00115 }
00116 
00117 static inline unsigned long long __xnarch_ullimd(unsigned long long ull,
00118                                                  u_long m,
00119                                                  u_long d) {
00120 
00121     unsigned long long mh, ml;
00122     u_long h, l, mlh, mll, qh, r, ql;
00123 
00124     h = ull >> 32; l = ull & 0xffffffff; /* Split ull. */
00125     mh = (unsigned long long) h * m;
00126     ml = (unsigned long long) l * m;
00127     mlh = ml >> 32; mll = ml & 0xffffffff; /* Split ml. */
00128     mh += mlh;
00129     qh = mh / d;
00130     r = mh % d;
00131     ml = (((unsigned long long) r) << 32) + mll; /* assemble r and mll */
00132     ql = ml / d;
00133 
00134     return (((unsigned long long) qh) << 32) + ql;
00135 }
00136 
00137 static inline long long xnarch_llimd(long long ll, u_long m, u_long d) {
00138     if(ll < 0)
00139         return -__xnarch_ullimd(-ll, m, d);
00140     return __xnarch_ullimd(ll, m, d);
00141 }
00142 
00143 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ullmul(unsigned long m1,
00144                                                unsigned long m2) {
00145     return (unsigned long long) m1 * m2;
00146 }
00147 
00148 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00149                                                 unsigned long uld,
00150                                                 unsigned long *rem)
00151 {
00152     if (rem)
00153         *rem = ull % uld;
00154 
00155     return ull / uld;
00156 }

00158 static inline unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long word) {
00159     return ffs((int)word) - 1;
00160 }

00167 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00168 
00169     const char *name;           /* Symbolic name of thread (can be NULL) */
00170     struct xnthread *thread;    /* VM thread pointer (opaque) */
00171     void *khandle;              /* Kernel handle (opaque) */
00172     void (*entry)(void *);      /* Thread entry */
00173     void *cookie;               /* Thread cookie passed on entry */
00174     int imask;                  /* Initial interrupt mask */
00175     jmp_buf rstenv;             /* Restart context info */
00176     pid_t ppid;
00177     int syncflag;
00178     pthread_t thid;
00179 
00180     /* The following fields are not used by the Fusion skin, however
00181        they are set by the nucleus. */
00182     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00183     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00184 
00185 } xnarchtcb_t;

00208 static inline int __attribute__ ((unused))
00209 xnarch_read_environ (const char *name, const char **ptype, void *pvar)
00210 
00211 {
00212     char *value;
00213 
00214     if (*ptype == NULL)
00215         return 0;       /* Already read in */
00216 
00217     value = getenv(name);
00218 
00219     if (!value)
00220         return -1;
00221 
00222     if (**ptype == 's')
00223         *((char **)pvar) = value;
00224     else
00225         *((int *)pvar) = atoi(value);
00226 
00227     *ptype = NULL;
00228 
00229     return 1;
00230 }
00231 
00232 static int inline xnarch_lock_irq (void) {
00233 
00234     return xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqlock,1);
00235 }
00236 
00237 static inline void xnarch_unlock_irq (int x) {
00238 
00239     extern int uvm_irqpend;
00240 
00241     if (!x && uvm_irqlock)
00242         {
00243         if (xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqpend,0))
00244             __pthread_release_uvm(&uvm_irqlock);
00245         else
00246             uvm_irqlock = 0;
00247         }
00248 }

00262 int uvm_irqlock = 0;
00263 
00264 int uvm_irqpend = 0;
00265 
00266 void xnarch_sync_irq (void)
00267 
00268 {
00269     if (uvm_irqlock)
00270         __pthread_hold_uvm(&uvm_irqpend);
00271 }
00272 
00273 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00274                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00275                                                    void *cookie),
00276                                    void *cookie) {
00277     if (irq == 0)
00278         return -EINVAL; /* Reserved for the timer thread. */
00279 
00280     return -ENOSYS;
00281 }

00333 static void xnarch_restart_handler (int sig) {
00334 
00335     longjmp(uvm_current->rstenv,1);
00336 }
00337 
00338 int main (int argc, char *argv[])
00339 
00340 {
00341     struct sigaction sa;
00342     int err;
00343 
00344     if (geteuid() !=0)
00345         {
00346         fprintf(stderr,"This program must be run with root privileges.\n");
00347         exit(1);
00348         }
00349 
00350     err = __fusion_sys_init();
00351 
00352     if (err)
00353         {
00354         fprintf(stderr,"sys_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00355         exit(2);
00356         }
00357 
00358     err = __fusion_skin_init();
00359 
00360     if (err)
00361         {
00362         fprintf(stderr,"skin_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00363         exit(3);
00364         }
00365 
00366     err = __fusion_user_init();
00367 
00368     if (err)
00369         {
00370         fprintf(stderr,"user_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00371         exit(4);
00372         }
00373 
00374     sa.sa_handler = &xnarch_restart_handler;
00375     sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00376     sa.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;
00377     sigaction(XNARCH_SIG_RESTART,&sa,NULL);
00378 
00379     for (;;)
00380         __pthread_idle_uvm(&uvm_irqlock);
00381 
00382     __fusion_user_exit();
00383     __fusion_skin_exit();
00384     __fusion_sys_exit();
00385 
00386     exit(0);
00387 }
00388 
00389 #endif  /* !XENO_MAIN_MODULE */

00418 #ifdef XENO_POD_MODULE
00419 
00420 extern void *uvm_timer_handle;
00421 
00422 xnsysinfo_t uvm_info;
00423 
00424 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_root;
00425 
00426 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_current;
00427 
00428 struct xnarch_tick_parms {
00429     time_t sec;
00430     long nsec;
00431     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00432     pid_t ppid;
00433     int syncflag;
00434 };
00435 
00436 /*
00437  * NOTE: System-level shadow priorities underlying the UVM threads are
00438  * defined as follows:
00439  *
00440  * - uvm-root = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO)
00441  * - uvm-<user> = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1(waiting) or 2(running)
00442  * - uvm-timer = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 3
00443  */
00444 
00445 static void *xnarch_timer_thread (void *cookie)
00446 
00447 {
00448     struct xnarch_tick_parms *p = (struct xnarch_tick_parms *)cookie;
00449     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00450     struct sched_param param;
00451     struct timespec ts;
00452 
00453     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 3;
00454     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00455 
00456     /* Copy the following values laid in our parent's stack before it
00457        is unblocked from the sync barrier by pthread_create_rt(). */
00458     ts.tv_sec = p->sec;
00459     ts.tv_nsec = p->nsec;
00460     tickhandler = p->tickhandler;
00461 
00462     pthread_create_rt("uvm-timer",NULL,p->ppid,&p->syncflag,&uvm_timer_handle);
00463     pthread_barrier_rt();       /* Wait for start. */
00464 
00465     for (;;)
00466         {
00467         nanosleep(&ts,NULL);
00468         xnarch_sync_irq();
00469         tickhandler();
00470         }
00471 
00472     return NULL;
00473 }
00474 
00475 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long nstick,
00476                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00477 {
00478     struct xnarch_tick_parms parms;
00479     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00480     pthread_t thid;
00481     int err;
00482 
00483     if (nstick == 0) /* UVM does not provide oneshot timing. */
00484         return -ENODEV;
00485 
00486     /* However, if oneshot timing is available at system level, use it
00487        so that we can provide a better resolution for virtual machine
00488        ticks. Otherwise, ask for plain periodic mode, hoping that the
00489        period given will be compatible with Linux's own requirements
00490        wrt its jiffy-based timer. */
00491 
00492 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER
00493     err = pthread_start_timer_rt(0);
00494 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER */
00495     err = pthread_start_timer_rt(nstick);
00496 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER */
00497 
00498     if (err)
00499         return err;
00500 
00501     parms.sec = nstick / 1000000000;
00502     parms.nsec = nstick % 1000000000;
00503     parms.tickhandler = tickhandler;
00504     parms.syncflag = 0;
00505     parms.ppid = getpid();
00506 
00507     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00508     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00509     pthread_create(&thid,&thattr,&xnarch_timer_thread,&parms);
00510     pthread_sync_rt(&parms.syncflag);
00511     pthread_start_rt(uvm_timer_handle);
00512 
00513     return 0;
00514 }
00515 
00516 static inline void xnarch_leave_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00517 }
00518 
00519 static inline void xnarch_enter_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00520 }
00521 
00522 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00523                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00524 {
00525     uvm_current = in_tcb;
00526     __pthread_activate_uvm(in_tcb->khandle,out_tcb->khandle);
00527 }
00528 
00529 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00530                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00531 {
00532     uvm_current = next_tcb;
00533     __pthread_cancel_uvm(dead_tcb->khandle,next_tcb->khandle);
00534 }
00535 
00536 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00537 
00538 {
00539     __pthread_cancel_uvm(dead_tcb->khandle,NULL);
00540 }
00541 
00542 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00543                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00544                                          const char *name)
00545 {
00546     struct sched_param param;
00547     int err;
00548 
00549     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO);
00550     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00551     err = pthread_info_rt(&uvm_info);
00552 
00553     if (err)
00554         {
00555         fprintf(stderr,"UVM init failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00556         exit(1);
00557         }
00558 
00559     pthread_init_rt("uvm-root",tcb,&tcb->khandle);
00560     tcb->name = name;
00561     uvm_root = uvm_current = tcb;
00562 }
00563 
00564 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00565 
00566     tcb->khandle = NULL;
00567 }
00568 
00569 static void *xnarch_thread_trampoline (void *cookie)
00570 
00571 {
00572     xnarchtcb_t *tcb = (xnarchtcb_t *)cookie;
00573     struct sched_param param;
00574 
00575     if (!setjmp(tcb->rstenv))
00576         {
00577         param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1;
00578         sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00579         pthread_create_rt(tcb->name,tcb,tcb->ppid,&tcb->syncflag,&tcb->khandle);
00580         pthread_barrier_rt();   /* Wait for start. */
00581         }
00582 
00583     xnarch_setimask(tcb->imask);
00584 
00585     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->thread);
00586 
00587     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00588 
00589     return NULL;
00590 }
00591 
00592 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00593                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00594                                        void *cookie,
00595                                        int imask,
00596                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00597                                        char *name)
00598 {
00599     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00600 
00601     if (tcb->khandle)   /* Restarting thread */
00602         {
00603         pthread_kill(tcb->thid,XNARCH_SIG_RESTART);
00604         return;
00605         }
00606 
00607     tcb->imask = imask;
00608     tcb->entry = entry;
00609     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00610     tcb->thread = thread;
00611     tcb->name = name;
00612     tcb->ppid = getpid();
00613     tcb->syncflag = 0;
00614 
00615     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00616     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00617     pthread_create(&tcb->thid,&thattr,&xnarch_thread_trampoline,tcb);
00618 
00619     pthread_sync_rt(&tcb->syncflag);
00620 }
00621

00634 int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00635 
00636 {
00637     spl_t s;
00638     splhigh(s);
00639     splexit(!!imask);
00640     return !!s;
00641 }

00653 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00654 
00655     return 0;
00656 }
00657 
00658 #define xnarch_notify_ready()  /* Nullified */
00659 #define xnarch_notify_shutdown() /* Nullified */
00660 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00661 
00662 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00663 
00664 extern xnsysinfo_t uvm_info;
00665 
00666 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long tsc) {
00667 
00668     nanostime_t ns;
00669     return pthread_tsc2ns_rt(tsc,&ns) ? 0 : ns;
00670 }
00671 
00672 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00673 
00674     nanostime_t tsc;
00675     return pthread_ns2tsc_rt(ns,&tsc) ? 0 : tsc;
00676 }
00677 
00678 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void)
00679 
00680 {
00681     nanotime_t t;
00682     pthread_time_rt(&t);
00683     return t;
00684 }
00685 
00686 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_tsc (void)
00687 
00688 {
00689     nanotime_t t;
00690     pthread_cputime_rt(&t);
00691     return t;
00692 }
00693 
00694 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00695     return uvm_info.cpufreq;
00696 }
00697 
00698 static inline void xnarch_halt (const char *emsg) {
00699     fprintf(stderr,"UVM fatal: %s\n",emsg);
00700     fflush(stderr);
00701     exit(99);
00702 }
00703 
00704 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes) {
00705     return malloc(bytes);
00706 }
00707 
00708 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes) {
00709     free(chunk);
00710 }

00718 #define xnarch_free_stack  xnfree
